DataElement.preferredName: Optical Coherence Tomography Scan Obtain Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator for whether an optical coherence tomography scan was obtained.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device._To come into possession of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition.:The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Concepts.definition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Property.preferredDefinition: To come into possession of something. (Concept includes term form "Obtained")

Concepts.definition: To come into possession of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
